inventory.commentary: 12jun08 - revised features, defs. added idiomatic Sense 6 ahouston

sense.name: the act of intentionally adding something extra
sense.commentary: ADDITION[+event][+adding_on][+something] Note: cannot substitute 'increase' for 'addition' here, in contrast to Sense 2
sense.examples: The addition of saffron to the rice makes a lovely flavor. Her additions of color accents and lighting made the room seem more inviting. The addition of new restrictions on Italian imports may start a trade war.

sense.name: an increase in magnitude
sense.commentary: ADDITION[+quantity][+magnitude][+increase] Note: Replacing 'addition' with 'increase' doesn't change the meaning of the sentence. Note: refers to a numerical increase, not a new entity in a collection (Sense 3)
sense.examples: There has been no addition to gasoline prices this month. The study reported a significant addition to the number of bankruptcy cases filed. The town was concerned about measurable additions of heavy metals in the drinking water.

sense.name: a thing added to an existing set or collection
sense.commentary: ADDITION[+collection][+member][+new] Note: different from sense 1 in that a collection of similar things is implied in Sense 3
sense.examples: The art museum has acquired several important additions to its Cubist collection. We are building a new addition onto the living room. (adding room to set of rooms) There were three additions to the programming staff last month. (set of employees) A raincoat is a useful addition to your wardrobe. (set of clothes)

sense.name: areas defined for real estate development
sense.examples: The developers are planning five new additions on the edge of town. Our town has strict zoning laws for additions to existing neighborhoods.

sense.name: a mathematical operation
sense.commentary: ADDITION[+process][+operation][+mathematical][+accumulation] Note: the activity of performing addition of numbers
sense.examples: Can these children perform simple addition? The addition operator is symmetric. The addition of 5 to 4 equals 9.

sense.name: an adverbial clause asserting that more is included
sense.commentary: IDIOM: adverbial modifier of a main clause. Note: an idiomatic expression 'in addition' or 'in addition to'
sense.examples: In addition to their salary, employees receive workers compensation and health care insurance. In addition, she mentioned that the servers would be down over the weekend for system upgrades.
